# Draft:Dr Tara Swart

----
Dr. Tara  Swart (MD, PhD)
Dr. Tara Swart (born c. 1970s) is a neuroscientist, medical doctor, leadership adviser, podcaster and best-selling author. She holds senior lecturer roles at MIT Sloan School of Management and King’s College London. Her work focuses on bridging neuroscience and spirituality to help individuals and leaders harness mental resilience, intuition, and brain-based wellbeing.
https://www.taraswart.com/about-dr-tara-swart/
https://www.harpercollins.com/blogs/authors/dr-tara-swart-md-phd-20181161520940
Education & Early Career
Dr. Tara earned a medical degree (BM BCh) from the University of Oxford and a PhD in neuropharmacology from King’s College London
https://www.harpercollins.com/blogs/authors/dr-tara-swart-md-phd-20181161520940
Completed psychiatric residency across several institutions, including the Royal Free Hospital in London .
Academic & Professional Positions
Senior Lecturer, Applied Neuroscience, at MIT Sloan School of Management; Visiting Senior Lecturer at King’s College London; guest lecturer at Oxford, Stanford, and MIT Sloan
https://www.harpercollins.com/blogs/authors/dr-tara-swart-md-phd-20181161520940?utm_source=chatgpt.com
Executive adviser to FTSE 100 companies, Fortune 500 firms, hedge funds, Magic Circle law firms, and ultra-high-net-worth entrepreneurs
Publications & Thought Leadership
Author of The Source (2019), a best-seller published by Penguin UK and HarperCollins, which explores the neuroscience behind the Law of Attraction; translated into 38 territories
https://www.penguin.co.uk/books/438207/the-source-by-dr-tara-swart/9781785042003
Editor and co-author of Neuroscience for Leadership: Harnessing the Brain Gain Advantage, an award-winning title
speakers.co.uk
https://www.taraswart.com/research/
Upcoming book SIGNS (September 2025), detailing neuroscience and spirituality, with endorsements from Jay Shetty and Mel Robbins
https://www.penguin.co.uk/books/467890/the-signs-by-swart-dr-tara/9781846048494
Science & Industry Leadership
Dr Tara has held a number of positions for brands as Chief Science Officer, first at Heights then appointed Chief Science Officer at DIRTEA in 2024, leading its Science Board and providing research-backed guidance on functional mushroom products
https://www.naturalproductsonline.co.uk/health-nutrition/acclaimed-neuroscientist-dr-tara-swart-appointed-as-chief-science-officer-for-dirtea/
Past roles include Neuroscientist-in-Residence at Corinthia Hotel London, Spokesperson for Aromatherapy Associates, and Chief Neuroscience Officer at Arowana International
speakersassociates.com
https://www.taraswart.com/about-dr-tara-swart
Public Engagement & Media
Her interview on Diary of a CEO cumulatively attracted over 22 million views, making it the podcast’s most-watched episode
https://www.penguin.co.uk/books/467890/the-signs-by-swart-dr-tara/9781846048494
Contributor to major publications including Forbes, Financial Times, Fast Company, and Wall Street Journal; frequently speaks at global conferences and business schools
speakers.co.uk
https://www.speakers.co.uk/speakers/tara-swart
Advocacy & Other Roles
Serves as a trustee for The Lady Garden Foundation, raising awareness for gynaecological cancer
https://www.taraswart.com/about-dr-tara-swart
Founder of initiatives like Organisational Plasticity, exploring neuroplasticity and epigenetics in business contexts
taraswart.com

Personal Philosophy
Dr. Swart blends scientific rigor with intuitive insight and values authenticity in promoting mental resilience, creativity, cultural appreciation, and spiritual wellbeing—aiming to make neuroscience accessible and empowering for a wider audience.
